borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div>The proposed ground and first floor rear extensions&nbsp;would introduce a significant mass and bulk to the rear of the&nbsp;dwelling. The combination of the existing and proposed ground floor rear extensions&nbsp;would introduce a mass and bulk which is out-of-keeping with the character and design of the original dwelling and the&nbsp;modest-sized dwellings along Beccles Drive, resulting in the dwelling seeming disproportionately larger than its neighbours. The proposed first floor rear extension introduces a mass at first floor level which presents an overbearing appearance which is not subordinate to the original dwelling. It is considered that the combined existing and proposed rear elements do not read as a subservient addition to the dwelling.&nbsp;The proposal fails to respect and reflect the character and design of the original dwelling, the terrace row and the wider area.
